clinical_study.brief_title: Incidence and Predictors of Opioid Overdose and Death in ER/LA Opioid Users as Measured by Diagnoses and Death Records
clinical_study.official_title: Incidence and Predictors of Opioid Overdose and Death Among ER/LA Opioid Analgesics Users as Measured by Diagnoses and Death Records - a Retrospective Database Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Member Companies of the Opioid PMR Consortium

clinical_study.source: Member Companies of the Opioid PMR Consortium

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective study to assess incidence and predictors of opioid abuse, addiction, overdose & death among patients prescribed ER/LA opioid products

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to quantify certain risks, and predictors of the risks, associated with the long-term use of ER/LA opioids for the treatment of chronic pain using coded terms in large health databases maintained by healthcare providers and health insurers using validated measures of these risks developed in companion studies and in parallel with a prospective, questionnaire-based cohort study of these risks.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Retrospective review over period from January 1, 2006 to December 31, 2013

intervention.intervention_name: Database review to evaluate opioid overdose and death
intervention.description: Database review to evaluate opioid overdose and death

study_pop.textblock:
The source populations will be those members of the selected health plans and insurance programs identified for which full demographic, provider, facility and pharmacy data are available, and in which protected health information (PHI) can be linked to death certificate information.
The four large healthcare systems that have established electronic databases for studying coded terminology outcomes selected for this study are: Kaiser Permanente Northwest (KPNW); Group Health Cooperative (GHC); Optum with access to the Optum Research Database (ORD), containing United Healthcare commercial insurance data; and Vanderbilt University with access to Medicaid data for the State of Tennessee (TennCare)"

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- In the primary analysis, cohort members will have had information represented in the database for at least six months, with no ER/LA opioid dispensing prior to a recorded ER/LA opioid dispensing occurring in 2006 or later.
- In the secondary analysis, no restriction on the duration cohort members must have had information represented in the database will be used.
